code: @Article{,   title = {Adaptive Shrinkage with a Nonparametric Bayesian Lasso},   author = {Santiago Marin and Bronwyn Loong and Anton H. Westveld},   journal = {Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics},   year = {2025},   doi = {https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.2025.2572327 }, }

title: Adaptive Shrinkage with a Nonparametric Bayesian Lasso
text: repository contains R package bnplasso (developer’s version), implements Nonparametric Bayesian Lasso (Marin et al., 2025+). main routine package, bnplasso.lm(), returns object S3 class, "lmBayes", supported various methods like print(), summary(), plot(), fitted(), residuals(), coef(), predict(), allowing users quickly visualize, evaluate, analyze output familiar fashion. package also implements Bayesian Lasso (Park Casella, 2008) Bayesian adaptive Lasso (Leng et al., 2014), functions blasso.lm() balasso.lm(), respectively.

title: Adaptive Shrinkage with a Nonparametric Bayesian Lasso
text: can install developer’s version via devtools : hand, wish install package bnplasso folder supplementary materials Marin et al. (2025+): R, set working directory folder bnplasso. Run following R code:

title: Adaptive Shrinkage with a Nonparametric Bayesian Lasso
text: Detailed guidelines using package functions referred help pages R. Additional examples available https://github.com/marinsantiago/bnplasso-examples.

what: Fit linear regression models with a Bayesian adaptive Lasso prior — balasso.lm
title: Fit linear regression models with a Bayesian adaptive Lasso prior — balasso.lm
text: function fits linear regression models Bayesian adaptive Lasso prior Leng et al. (2014).

title: Fit linear regression models with a Bayesian adaptive Lasso prior — balasso.lm
code: balasso.lm(   X,   y,   a,   b,   intercept = FALSE,   variance.prior.type = "conjugate",   max.iters = 6000L,   burn.in = 1000L,   thin = 1L )

title: Fit linear regression models with a Bayesian adaptive Lasso prior — balasso.lm
text: X matrix predictors dimension \(n\)--\(p\), \(n\) rows observation vector. y Response variable. numeric vector size \(n\). positive scalar corresponding shape parameter gamma distribution used hyper-prior shrinkage parameters, \(\lambda_{j}^{2}\), \(j\\{1,\dots,n\}\). b positive scalar corresponding rate parameter gamma distribution used hyper-prior shrinkage parameters, \(\lambda_{j}^{2}\), \(j\\{1,\dots,n\}\). intercept Logical. TRUE, intercept term included model; otherwise, intercept integrated . TRUE, prior intercept non-informative prior form \(p(\mu)\propto 1\). Default FALSE. variance.prior.type character string denoting whether variance sampling variance independent-type prior conjugate-type prior. See Moran et al. (2019) details. options either "independent" "conjugate". Default "conjugate" Leng et al. (2014). max.iters positive integer corresponding total number MCMC iterations. Default 6000. burn.positive integer corresponding number draws discarded burn-. smaller max.iters. Default 1000. thin positive integer specifying period saving samples. Default 1.

title: Fit linear regression models with a Bayesian adaptive Lasso prior — balasso.lm
text: object S3 class, "lmBayes", containing: Post.beta: matrix size n.draws--n.preds,   row posterior draw regression coefficients. Post.sigma2: vector size n.draws,   element posterior draw sampling variance. Post.tau2: matrix size n.draws--n.preds,   row posterior draw latent parameters   \(\tau_{j}^{2}\). Post.lambda2: matrix size   n.draws--n.preds, row posterior draw   shrinkage parameters \(\lambda_{j}^{2}\). Post.mu: vector size n.draws, element   posterior draw intercept term. elapsed: elapsed (wall-clock) time MCMC sampler. : shape parameter gamma distribution   used hyper-prior. b: rate parameter gamma distribution   used hyper-prior. intercept: Whether intercept term included   model. variance.prior.type: Whether variance sampling   variance independent-type prior conjugate-type prior. max.iters: total number MCMC iterations. burn.: number draws discarded burn-. thin: period saving draws. n.obs: sample size. n.preds: number predictors. n.draws: number posterior draws burn-  thinning. X: Matrix predictors. y: Vector responses. post.pred.fitted.values: matrix size   n.draws--n.obs, row draw posterior   predictive distribution fitted values. post.pred.residuals: matrix size   n.draws--n.obs, row draw posterior   predictive distribution residuals.

title: Fit linear regression models with a Bayesian adaptive Lasso prior — balasso.lm
text: C. Leng, MN. Tran, D. Nott (2014), Bayesian adaptive Lasso. Ann Inst Stat Math, 66:221-244 G. E. Moran, V. Rockova, E. . George (2019), Variance Prior Forms High-Dimensional Bayesian Variable Selection. Bayesian Analysis, 14(4):1091-1119.

what: bnplasso: Fit linear regression models with the Nonparametric Bayesian Lasso — bnplasso
title: bnplasso: Fit linear regression models with the Nonparametric Bayesian Lasso — bnplasso
text: Fit linear regression models Nonparametric Bayesian Lasso, novel adaptive shrinkage prior Bayesian regression variable selection. Posterior inference conducted via Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) described Marin et al. (2025+) <https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.2025.2572327>.

title: bnplasso: Fit linear regression models with the Nonparametric Bayesian Lasso — bnplasso
text: S. Marin, B. Long,. H. Westveld (2025+), Adaptive Shrinkage Nonparametric Bayesian Lasso. Journal Computational Graphical Statistics. doi:10.1080/10618600.2025.2572327

what: Fit linear regression models with a nonparametric Bayesian Lasso prior — bnplasso.lm
title: Fit linear regression models with a nonparametric Bayesian Lasso prior — bnplasso.lm
text: function fits linear regression models nonparametric Bayesian Lasso prior Marin et al. (2025+).

title: Fit linear regression models with a nonparametric Bayesian Lasso prior — bnplasso.lm
code: bnplasso.lm(   X,   y,   a,   b,   alpha,   intercept = FALSE,   variance.prior.type = "independent",   max.iters = 6000L,   burn.in = 1000L,   thin = 1L )

title: Fit linear regression models with a nonparametric Bayesian Lasso prior — bnplasso.lm
text: X matrix predictors dimension \(n\)--\(p\), \(n\) rows observation vector. y Response variable. numeric vector size \(n\). positive scalar corresponding shape parameter gamma distribution used centering measure DP prior. b positive scalar corresponding rate parameter gamma distribution used centering measure DP prior. alpha positive scalar corresponding concentration parameter DP prior. intercept Logical. TRUE, intercept term included model; otherwise, intercept integrated . TRUE, prior intercept non-informative prior form \(p(\mu)\propto 1\). Default FALSE. variance.prior.type character string denoting whether variance sampling variance independent-type prior conjugate-type prior. See Moran et al. (2019) details. options either "independent" "conjugate". Default "independent". max.iters positive integer corresponding total number MCMC iterations. Default 6000. burn.positive integer corresponding number draws discarded burn-. smaller max.iters. Default 1000. thin positive integer specifying period saving samples. Default 1.

title: Fit linear regression models with a nonparametric Bayesian Lasso prior — bnplasso.lm
text: object S3 class, "lmBayes", containing: Post.beta: matrix size n.draws--n.preds,   row posterior draw regression coefficients. Post.sigma2: vector size n.draws,   element posterior draw sampling variance. Post.tau2: matrix size n.draws--n.preds,   row posterior draw latent parameters   \(\tau_{j}^{2}\). Post.lambda2: matrix size   n.draws--n.preds, row posterior draw   shrinkage parameters \(\lambda_{j}^{2}\). Post.clust_idx: matrix size   n.draws--n.preds, row indicates cluster   regression coefficients belong . Post.K: vector size n.draws, element   indicates number clusters corresponding MCMC iteration. Post.mu: vector size n.draws, element   posterior draw intercept term. elapsed: elapsed (wall-clock) time MCMC sampler. : shape parameter gamma distribution   used centering measure Dirichlet process prior. b: rate parameter gamma distribution   used centering measure Dirichlet process prior. alpha: concentration parameter Dirichlet   process prior. intercept: Whether intercept term included   model. variance.prior.type: Whether variance sampling   variance independent-type prior conjugate-type prior. max.iters: total number MCMC iterations. burn.: number draws discarded burn-. thin: period saving draws. n.obs: sample size. n.preds: number predictors. n.draws: number posterior draws burn-  thinning. X: Matrix predictors. y: Vector responses. post.pred.fitted.values: matrix size   n.draws--n.obs, row draw posterior   predictive distribution fitted values. post.pred.residuals: matrix size   n.draws--n.obs, row draw posterior   predictive distribution residuals.

what: Expected log pointwise predictive density (elppd) — elppd
title: Expected log pointwise predictive density (elppd) — elppd
text: function computes expected log pointwise predictive density (elppd) object class lmBayes. Given test (held-) set, \(\{y_{\text{test},},\, \mathbf{x}_{\text{test},}\}_{=1}^{n_{\text{test}}}\), elppd defined $$\text{elppd} = \frac{1}{n_{\text{test}}}\sum_{=1}^{n_{\text{test}}} \log\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{s=1}^{S}p\left({y}_{\text{test}, } | \mathbf{x}_{\text{test}, }^{_{'}}\boldsymbol{\beta}_{(s)}, \sigma^{2}_{(s)}\right)\right),$$ \(p()\) likelihood observed data \(\boldsymbol{\beta}_{(s)}\) \(\sigma^{2}_{(s)}\) \(s\)-th draws coefficient vector sampling variance MCMC algorithm, respectively.

title: Expected log pointwise predictive density (elppd) — elppd
Expected log pointwise predictive density (elppd) — elppd
text: object object class lmBayes. X.new matrix predictors test data, row observation. y.new vector responses test data size \(n_{\text{test}}\).

title: Point estimates of the regression coefficients for an object of class lmBayes. — point.estimates
Point estimates of the regression coefficients for an object of class lmBayes. — point.estimates
text: object object class 'lmBayes'. type character string denoting algorithm used recover point estimates. options : () "sn" scaled neighborhood criterion Li Lin (2010), (ii) "cred.int" excludes predictor 50% credible interval contains zero, (iii) "post.mode" posterior mode, (iv) "post.mean" posterior mean. Default "sn". retain character string denoting posterior summary retained type = "sn" type = "cred.int". options : () "mode" retain posterior mode (ii) "mean" retain posterior mean.
